summary: Luffy, Usopp and Nami are shown around Dock 1 before Kaku returns with to report his findings during his evaluation of Going Merry.
cover: Color Spread: The Straw Hat Pirates take a Going Merry-themed train (carrying a quartered N-E-W-S coat of arms) on a railway through the sky.

title: The Pirate Abduction Incident
summary: Luffy and Nami learn the fate of the Going Merry and realize Usopp has been taken by the Franky Family along with 200,000,000.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 13: "Sky Boss vs. Dirt Boss".

title: My Name Is "Franky"
summary: Nami informs the other members of what happened while Usopp tries to retrieve the money on his own.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 14: "A Careless Defeat".

title: It's Decided
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates attack the Franky Family to get revenge for Usopp and finally decide it is time to say goodbye to the Going Merry.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 15: "Tamed It, and Carelessly Remodeled Its Helmet".

title: The Big Argument
summary: Luffy and Usopp argue over what to do with the Going Merry, with Usopp wanting to keep repairing it and Luffy wanting to get a ship.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 16: "Dig, Boss, Dig".

title: Luffy vs. Usopp
summary: Usopp and Luffy fight for the Going Merry.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 17: "Dug It Up, Yeah~"

title: Captain
summary: The duel between Usopp and Luffy continues with a victor finally emerging in the end.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 18: "The Boom's Brought Out the Forest Boss".

title: Big Trouble in the Secret Room
summary: It is the morning after Usopp and Luffy's duel and the Straw Hat Pirates learn that Iceburg was shot.
cover: Color Spread: The Straw Hat Pirates play with a beach ball atop a huge Sea King's body.

title: WARNING
summary: An angry Franky searches for the Straw Hats, while it is revealed that Aqua Laguna is due to hit the island. Iceburg finally regains consciousness and reveals that there were two attackers, one being Nico Robin.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 19: "The Forest Boss Falls to the Sky Boss".

title: Luffy vs. Franky
summary: Franky and Luffy begin to fight outside the shipyard while the Galley-La Company conclude that the Straw Hats are involved in the attack on Iceburg and go to confront them.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 20: "Leave the Island to the Forest Boss, and Dig, Dirt Boss, Dig".

title: Protectors of the City of Water
summary: Luffy is confronted by the Galley-La Company members and it is announced to the residents of Water 7 that the Straw Hats are the culprits.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 21: "Boom—An Oasis in the Desert".

title: Coup de Vent
summary: The Galley-La Company continue to attack Luffy until Franky intervenes and destroys the shipyard.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 22: "Koza's Uncle—Toto's Brother—Goro Has Stopped By".

title: Rumors
summary: Luffy finally confronts Iceburg about the shooting incident while Robin is seen meeting with members of an organization known as CP9.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 23: "The Hot Spring Inspection Force".

title: The Woman Who Brings Darkness
summary: While the Straw Hats are being chased, Sanji and Chopper finally come face to face with Robin.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 24: "A Surprise On Returning: The Forest Boss's Big Idea".

title: Devil
summary: The Straw Hats figure out that Robin is most likely going to make another attempt on Iceburg's life and decide to try and catch her to discover the truth.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 25: "A Tunnel To Ukkari Hot-Springs Island Opens In the Kingdom of Sand".

title: The Messengers of Darkness
summary: The Franky Family think of a way to lure out the Straw Hat Pirates while the CP9 and Nico Robin begin an attack on the Galley-La Headquarters.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 26: "Grand Opening: The Hasami Undersea Bus".

title: Cipher Pol No.9
summary: The assault on the Galley-La Headquarters continues with the Straw Hat Pirates finally arriving.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 27: "Enter: The Princess's Entourage".

title: Opposing Force
summary: The CP9 members continue to make light work of the Galley-La Company while Iceburg and Paulie reveal that the blueprints are fake.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 28: "The Men's Bath".

title: The Concealed
summary: Luffy arrives at the Galley-La Headquarters while the CP9 members reveal their identities.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 29: "The Women's Bath".

title: The 9th Justice
summary: The agents of CP9 deduce who has the blueprints while the four Straw Hat Pirates with Paulie make their entrance.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 30: "Gedatsu-sama: Boss of the Blue Sea".

title: Rokushiki
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates and Paulie confronts the CP9 members and Nico Robin.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Vol. 31: "That's Bath-Man, Master Gedatsu".

title: Fighting Power
summary: Nico Robin begins to leave while the Straw Hat Pirates try to get past CP9 to stop her.
cover: Gedatsu's Accidental Blue-Sea Life, Conclusion: "Come On Down To Ukkari Hot-Spring Island".

title: One Citizen
summary: Rob Lucci shows his Devil Fruit ability while the Galley-La Headquarters continues to be engulfed in flames.
cover: Animal Theater: Luffy takes a pottery class taught by a warthog, who finds his enthusiasm far outstrips his talent.

title: The Warehouse Under the Bridge
summary: The CP9 look for Franky's location while at he is at a hideout. Franky and Usopp chat about the events which they have been involved in.
cover: Animal Theater: Sanji plays a guitar by the seaside, a whale breaching behind him.

title: Klabautermann
summary: Franky continues to try to get Usopp to accept the Going Merry can never sail again.
cover: Animal Theater: Nami takes up dog-grooming, (somehow) fashioning a "granny" topknot and a pompadour onto two dogs. Next in line is a terrier already frozen in terror.

title: Tom's Workers
summary: The CP9 enter the hideout and demand Franky to hand over the blueprints of Pluton.
cover: Color Spread: "There's An Open Road."

title: The Legendary Shipwright
summary: The story goes back 22 years to explain the events that unfolded around Tom's Workers.
cover: Animal Theater: Zoro goes scuba-diving, and encounters a huge anglerfish.

title: Sea Train
summary: Tom's Workers build the Sea Train.
cover: Animal Theater: Chopper—in Brain Point—takes down a heavyweight bear in a judo match, while a lightweight puma and a middleweight pig look on in shock.

title: Spandam
summary: As the day of Tom's trial draws closer, Spandam arrives.
cover: Animal Theater: In a knee-deep snowscape, Usopp patiently practices archery under a canine sensei.

title: Tom-san
summary: Tom's Workers are blamed for the attack on the court.
cover: Animal Theater: Robin takes a "taxi"—i.e. a deep-sleeping ostrich with a "Wait Until the Noon" sign tied around its neck.

title: Cutty Flam
summary: Cutty Flam attempts to stop Tom being taken away by Spandam.
cover: Color Spread: "Mugiwara Pirates Venture to Water 7".

title: Revival
summary: The chapter talks about the events after Tom's death and the CP9 prepare to take Franky away.
cover: Animal Theater: The Going Merry sails through a sunny sea, surrounded by seagulls, dolphins, whales, and Sea Kings of every size and shape.

title: Bingo
summary: Iceburg explains Robin's true motive for causing so much trouble.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 1: "A House in the Jungle".

title: Departing Soon
summary: Paulie explains to the people that the Straw Hat Pirates are not the culprits but does not tell them everything he knows. He gets the mob to follow Chopper so they can search for the rest of the crew. Nami goes her own way so she can rush to the Sea Train. As Nami nears the station, Sanji, ahead of her, approaches the train.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works" Vol. 2: "Newspaper, Please".

title: P.S.
summary: The Sea Train leaves Water 7 with Robin, Usopp, Franky, and the CP9 agents on board.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 3: "A Baroque Downfall: My Comrades Revealed".

title: Ebb Tide
summary: Sanji makes his way into the 7th cart and easily defeats its representative, Jerry. Meanwhile everyone at Water 7 continues their search for Luffy and Zoro and eventually spot Luffy as the Aqua Laguna is about to arrive!
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 4: "Let's Go To Prison!!"

title: Aqua Laguna
summary: Nami and Chopper make their way towards the stuck Luffy and Zoro as the Aqua Laguna arrives.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 5: "Colors Trap: Yellow-Green of Friendship. Let's Go."

title: Kokoro
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates escape from the Aqua Laguna and are determined to go save the others at Enies Lobby.
cover: Color Spread: "Let Me See What You Can Do".

title: Rocketman!!
summary: Sanji defeats all in the next cart which is where Franky and Usopp are located while the other Straw Hat Pirates prepare to leave Water 7 using the second Sea Train, the "Rocketman"!
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 6: "The Great Escape From the Isle of Giants".

title: Sortie!!
summary: The Rocketman leaves with the Straw Hat Pirates, Franky Family and Galley-La Company as Sanji finally contacts Nami.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Side Issue: "The Isle of Giants, Thereafter".

title: Sogeking
summary: The Rocketman passes through the Aqua Laguna while Sanji and Franky are saved by a mysterious masked man named Sogeking.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 7: "Raining the Ink Away".

title: Sea Train Battle Game
summary: After detaching the previous two coaches, the three on the Puffing Tom make their way to coach four.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 8: "Now Landing On Kyuka Island".

title: Ramen Kenpo
summary: Sanji fights Wanze while Franky prepares to battle Nero. Meanwhile, Sogeking has managed to reach the first coach!
cover: Color Spread: "Crash! We Can Fight It!"

title: You're Not Alone
summary: Nico Robin and Sogeking talk in the first car while the others continue their battles.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 9: "Kyuka Island's Crawling With Marines".

title: The Admirable Captain T Bone
summary: Roronoa Zoro defeats T Bone.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 10: "Today's Agenda: A Fun Little Fugitive Hunt".

title: Parage
summary: The battles aboard the Puffing Tom continue with Sanji defeating Wanze.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 11: "Mr. 2, Master of Breakouts".

title: Necessary Evil
summary: Those on the Puffing Tom attempt to escape the CP9.
cover: Color Spread: Under a summer shower, Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, Chopper, and Nami stand in elaborate yukatas, wielding oil-paper parasols along with a combination of swords and firearms. Behind them, a row of frogs are singing.

title: Scramble
summary: Nico Robin and Franky are once again in the hands of the CP9.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 12: "For Now, Let's Try Disguises".

title: The Superhumans of Enies Lobby
summary: The Rocketman and Franky Family continue their way to Enies Lobby.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 13: "Hina Sees".

title: I Got It!!!
summary: The group prepares to enter Enies Lobby.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 14: "Hina Attacks".

title: Great Battle on the Judiciary Island!!
summary: Monkey D. Luffy makes his way to the main island just as the Franky Family and Galley-La Company arrive on Enies Lobby.
cover: Color Spread: "Mugiwara Pirates vs. Cipher Pol No. 9."

title: Damage Report
summary: The Franky Family try to pass through the giants, while Luffy makes his way past the Marines on the main island.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 15: "The Getaway".

title: Doriki
summary: The CP9 reunion appears more of a comedy show as Monkey D. Luffy continues on his way towards the courthouse.
cover: Color Spread: "Summer Time."

title: Enies Lobby Main Island Express
summary: The Rocketman crash lands into the main island.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 16: "Miss Valentine Caught".

title: Fired
summary: The rest of the Straw Hat Pirates set foot on Enies Lobby. Nami's Perfect Clima-Tact's power is revealed, and the Straw Hats hurry to catch up with Luffy. Meanwhile Luffy fights Marines, and notice that his crew is here. Back in the scene, Paulie tells Zoro that if he ever meets Lucci, Kaku, or Kalifa, to tell them they are fired.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 17: "Show Yourselves!!"

title: Demon Lair
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates charge in further while Spandam kicks and hurts Robin and Franky. Blueno notices that the snail phone's receiver is off the hook. After being dismissed by Spandam, he goes to check on things outside and meets Luffy.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 18: "The Figure Fleeing Kyuka Island".

title: Luffy vs Blueno
summary: Luffy tells Blueno to move and Blueno starts talking about the World Government. The rest of the Straw Hat Pirates, Galley-La Company and Franky Family charge in further meanwhile. Back at the scene, Luffy begins to clashes with Blueno. Sodom gets hurt in the battlefield and tells everyone to get off of him onto Gomorrah.
cover: Color Spread: "The Winner Takes It All."

title: Signal the Counterattack
summary: Sogeking talks with Oimo to find out that he and Kashii have been working at Enies Lobby for 50 years in order to "free" Dorry and Brogy from Impel Down. Sogeking tells Oimo that that story is a complete lie by the World Government since the Straw Hat Pirates met them recently. The others meanwhile charge in further. When they are at a pinch, Oimo and Kashii show up, appearing to be allies now, thanks to Sogeking.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 19: "Stop Right There!"

title: There Is a Way
summary: Kaku and Kalifa are given devil fruits by Spandam and eat them. The Straw Hat Pirates charge in further, and Luffy continues to clash with Blueno.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 20: "You Cannot Stray From Humankind's Way".

title: Unprecedented
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates finally reach the last gates, and Spandam is notified of the damage caused by them.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 21: "Help!!"

title: Gear
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates charge in further while Luffy fights Blueno and activates Gear 2 for the first time.
cover: Color Spread: "Is He Strong? Watch Off!"

title: Gear 2
summary: Luffy fights Blueno in his Gear 2 and beats him. The other Straw Hats rush to catch up with Luffy, and Luffy calls out to Robin.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 22: "The Surrender(!?) of Mr. 3".

title: Response
summary: Luffy talks with Robin who tells him to stay away and that she just wants to die. The CP9 are called and gather on the tower.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 23: "Explosion!! The Fake Mr. 3's Okama Kenpo".

title: Accepting the Challenge
summary: ﻿The rest of the Straw Hats fight to catch up to Luffy. Luffy talks with Robin, and the rest of the Straw Hats catch up and stand beside Luffy.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 24: "The Fateful Showdown!! Mr. 2 vs. Black Cage Hina".

title: The Girl Called a Devil
summary: ﻿The Straw Hat Pirates wait for a response from Robin, and the story of Robin's history begins.
cover: Color Spread: The Straw Hat Pirates make camp on a tundra too cold for even polar bears, penguins, and walruses. While Zoro and Usopp desperately try to start a fire (Sanji impatiently urging them on so he can cook hot-pot), Nami chases after Chopper, eager to cuddle against his fur.

title: Dereshi
summary: ﻿More of Robin's past is revealed.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 25: "A Captain's Power".

title: Olvia
summary: More of Robin's past is revealed.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 26: "An Off-Guard Rescue".

title: The Demons of Ohara
summary: More of Robin's past is revealed.
cover: Color Spread: The Straw Hat Pirates explore a set of jungle ruins, Luffy and Chopper riding atop a tiger while Robin pets a dragon-like lizard.

title: Ohara vs. the World Government
summary: More of Robin's past is revealed.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 27: "Betrayal Black Takes This Ship Over".

title: Saul
summary: More of Robin's past is revealed.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 28: "To the Marines' Gaol".

title: In Hopes of Reaching the Future
summary: More of Robin's past is revealed, and Saul dies.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 29: "Pretend Prisoners, Slipping Into Gaol".

title: Declaration of War
summary: Robin's life running away from the world is revealed. The flashback ends. Luffy tells Sogeking to burn the World Government's flag and the Straw Hat Pirates declare war to the world. Luffy tells Robin to say she wants to live, and she does. The Straw Hat Pirates get ready for a battle with the CP9.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 30: "The Strongest Suspects".

title: Jump Toward the Waterfall!!
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates get ready for a fight. Franky burns the blueprints of Pluton. The Straw Hats burst into the main building of Enies Lobby on a Sea Train.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 31: "It's Been Too Long!! (Old-Lady-I-Haven't-Seen-In-Ages) and Young-Lady-I-Haven't-Seen-Ever".

title: The Key to Freedom
summary: The Rocketman bursts into the main tower of Enies Lobby, carrying the battle-ready Straw Hat Pirates. However, when they arrive, they are told that they must defeat a member of CP9 and obtain their keys to Robin's handcuffs. The crew splits up, encountering various members of CP9, while Spandam, Rob Lucci, and Robin head towards the Gates of Justice.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 32: "Back In Business!! Baroque Works".

title: Pirates vs CP9
summary: A few Straw Hat Pirates begin to fight with one CP9 agent each. While Luffy chases after Rob Lucci, Sogeking is assaulted by Jabra, and Zoro and Kaku begin fighting while the CP9 begin to show off their Devil Fruit abilities.
cover: Color Spread: The Straw Hat Pirates, bearing the furs and weapons of cavemen, hunt (and/or flee) a giant mammoth.

title: Handcuffs No. 2
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates versus CP9.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 33: "The Great Six-Man (and One Gun) Escape".

title: Mr. Chivalry
summary: The battles between the Straw Hat Pirates and CP9 intensify, as Sanji takes on Kalifa and Chopper and Nami encounter Kumadori. However, Sanji's morals prevent him from fighting at full power, handing him a defeat, and Nami and Chopper are pinned down by Kumadori's strange powers. Meanwhile, Luffy activates an unknown power for the first time that has great destroying abilities.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 34: "Escape Declined—Don't Feel Like It".

title: Franky vs Fukurou
summary: Franky fights Fukurou.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 35: "Colors Trap: Dream Rainbow. Become Your Aspiration!"

title: Power
summary: Franky continues to fight Fukurou while Kumadori comes out of the refrigerator in front of Tony Tony Chopper.
cover: Color Spread: "Yuke Yuke—Bokura no Chopper Man".

title: Seimei Kikan
summary: As the fights between the CP9 and the Straw Hat Pirates at Enies Lobby intensify, Fukurou is defeated by Franky, and Chopper engages Kumadori. Meanwhile, Zoro and Sogeking turn to fight Kaku and Jabra.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 36: "Become a Princess, an Artist, and Paula-From-the-Bar".

title: Monster
summary: The CP9 agents fight the Straw Hat Pirates: Tony Tony Chopper eats three Rumble Balls and activates Monster Point.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 37: "Become a Chocolate Lady, a Fireman, an Express Pizza Deliverer, and a Tank".

title: Monster vs Kumadori
summary: CP9's fight with the Straw Hat Pirates continues. Luffy encounters Rob Lucci.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 38: "Become the Pirate King and a Hero".

title: Emergency Bad News Broadcast
summary: CP9 vs. Straw Hat Pirates. Spandam accidentally activates the Buster Call.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 39: "A Wreck In the Wilderness".

title: Super-Size Nami
summary: The battle between CP9 and Straw Hats continues.
cover: Color Spread: The Straw Hat Pirates hold a riverside picnic with a half-dozen hungry dogs. The main course: hot dogs.

title: Nami vs Kalifa
summary: Nami's fight with Kalifa rages on.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 40: "All Together Now: The NEW Spiders Cafe".

title: You Missed Your Chance
summary: Nami defeats Kalifa. Franky sends Chopper into the ocean to get him back to normal and Zoro and Usopp finally get their cuffs off.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Vol. 41: "Mr. 0, 1, 2, 3."

title: Hunter
summary: Zoro and Kaku fight. Sogeking is defeated by Jabra. Sanji shows up to fight Jabra.
cover: Miss Goldenweek's "Operation: Meet Baroque Works", Conclusion: "Sentence Decided: The Great Prison Impel Down".

title: Sanji vs Jabra
summary: Sanji and Jabra start their fight.
cover: Animal Theater: Luffy and a water buffalo go bug-hunting.

title: Heat Up
summary: Sanji and Jabra continue their fight.
cover: Color Spread: "Les Trois Mousquetaires."

title: Zoro vs Kaku
summary: Zoro and Kaku fight.
cover: Animal Theater: Nami has a rhino serve as a lost-child post for baby birds, bemusing a local dog patrolman.

title: Asura
summary: After a long and difficult battle, Zoro managed to defeat Kaku and his Four Sword Style by using his new sword technique, Nine Sword Style.
cover: Animal Theater: Usopp trims a set of hedges in the shape of a bear, while an actual bear prepares a lunch of onigiri and grilled fish.

title: Luffy vs. Rob Lucci
summary: The fight between Monkey D. Luffy and Rob Lucci continues. Nico Robin tries to slow down her progress to the Gates of Justice. The rest of the Straw Hat Pirates, Franky, Kokoro, Chimney, and Gonbe try to catch up with Robin, while everyone else tries to escape Enies Lobby.
cover: Animal Theater: Chopper and a team of kangaroos train for an upcoming soccer match—using a hapless armadillo as their ball.

title: Legend of a Hero
summary: While Luffy continues his fight against Rob Lucci, Oimo, Kashii, the Franky Family and Galley-La Company continue their escape of Enies Lobby. The rest of the Straw Hat Pirates and Franky arrives just in time to save Robin.
cover: Animal Theater: Zoro and a less-than-brave tiger cross a forest in the dead of night, neither sure of their direction.

title: Buster Call
summary: Robin is freed from her Seastone handcuffs thanks to Franky and the Straw Hat Pirates. However, the Marines have arrived at Enies Lobby to commence the Buster Call. Meanwhile, Luffy and Lucci continues their fight.
cover: Animal Theater: Sanji prepares a massive cake for Nami and Robin, and cages a baboon that tries to taste it—while completely unaware that a colony of mice has already eaten most of the bottom layer.

title: Gear 3
summary: While the rest of the Straw Hat Pirates try to escape Enies Lobby, Luffy continues his battle against Lucci in which he activates his new technique, Gear 3.
cover: Animal Theater: Robin plays pool with a gang of koalas.

title: Rob Lucci
summary: While the Straw Hat Pirates and the Shift Station staff try to escape the flooded corridors of Enies Lobby, Luffy continues his fight against Lucci outside.
cover: Color Spread: "Speedsters!"

title: Mermaid Legend
summary: While Luffy deals with the side effects of Gear 3 during his battle against Lucci, the Straw Hat Pirates, Franky, Chimney and Gonbe manage to escape the water thanks to Kokoro.
cover: Animal Theater: Vivi and a pack of otters enjoy watermelons (painstakingly flown in by a flock of seagulls).

title: Escape Ship
summary: Luffy and Rob Lucci continue their fight despite the destruction of Enies Lobby.
cover: Where They Are Now, Shot 1: "Conis, Aisa, Raki and Nola Take A Walk On Vearth."

title: Bridge of Mortal Combat
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates, Franky and the Shift Station staff watch the battle between Luffy and Lucci.
cover: Where They Are Now, Shot 2: "Wyper and the Shandia, Forest Pioneers."

title: A Ship Waiting for Wind
summary: The Marines attack the Straw Hats on the Bridge of Hesitation. Luffy seems to have been defeated by Lucci.
cover: Color Spread: The Straw Hats enjoy themselves at the Sky Pine, a cloud-top hotel boasting seagulls, leis, and pineapples aplenty.

title: It's Not Like it's Hell Here
summary: Luffy defeats Rob Lucci.
cover: Where They Are Now, Shot 3: "Gan Fall and the Chief's Brilliant Pumpkin Plan."

title: Let's Go Back
summary: The assault of the Buster Call on Enies Lobby continues. The Straw Hats are backed into a corner and have to jump into the ocean.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 1: "Toward the Fairy Vearth".

title: Utter Defeat
summary: The Straw Hats get away on the Going Merry.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 2: "Upon the Fairy Vearth".

title: A Light Snow of Reminiscence Falls
summary: Usopp has put the mask back on, confusing Luffy and Chopper. The Straw Hats then meet the Galley-La ship, with Iceburg on it. They find out that it was Iceburg that repaired Going Merry after he had heard the Going Merry's wish to make just one more trip. The Going Merry is breaking apart though, and the crew decides to let her rest at last, giving her a Viking burial. An emotional barrage of images ensues, where the crew parts with the ship. Going Merry apologizes, but Luffy says it is all their fault. Going Merry says she was still so happy though, and thanks the crew one last time before she dies.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 3: "Something In This Crater".

title: Fist of Love
summary: Franky discusses his plan for the new ship with the Straw Hat Pirates. Afterwards, Luffy meets a Marine vice admiral he knows, who happens to be his grandfather.
cover: Color Spread: Stranded in a jungle, prep-schoolers Luffy, Robin, and Chopper befriend the local wildlife—lions, elephants, pythons, bulls, and more.

title: Jack-in-the-Box
summary: Garp reveals that Luffy's father is the most wanted man in the world and the leader of the Revolutionary Army, Monkey D. Dragon.
cover: A review of the Marine Ranks, with twelve illustrations: Sengoku, Aokiji, Tsuru, Garp, Saul, Smoker, Hina, Tashigi, Fullbody, Jango, and two surprise recruits.

title: The Name of That Sea is
summary: Koby tells Luffy about the latter half of Grand Line, which is called the New World. After the departure of the Marines, the Straw Hats throw a big party. Shanks and Whitebeard are about to meet in the New World, and the World Government are alerted to this meeting.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 4: "Someone's In This Hole".

title: Whitebeard and Red Hair
summary: Shanks and Whitebeard meet to discuss Marshall D. Teach, and the old days when Roger was around. This causes the Marines to panic, since the Four Emperors never meet like that.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 5: "Strike First, Ask Later".

title: You Have My Sympathies
summary: The Straw Hats learn about Fish-Man Island and the Florian Triangle. The whole crew gets new bounties, including Franky. The new ship is completed. Zambai asks Luffy to take Franky with him.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 6: "What Great Shame! I Have Survived!"

title: Pants from Franky House
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates are introduced to their newest ship, the Thousand Sunny.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 7: "First Lieutenant Spacey Regrets Disappearing In Action."

title: Naked But Great
summary: After some final and violent persuasion from the Straw Hat Pirates, particularly from Robin, Franky decides to join the crew, to follow his dream, and see it completed.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 8: "The Old Battlefield."

title: Pride
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates decide to take off, but after waiting a little while for Usopp. Suddenly, Garp attacks and the Straw Hats are forced to set sail just as Usopp arrives. When his great return plans fail, Usopp apologizes for being selfish and rejoins the crew.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 9: "The Approaching Shadow".

title: The Third and the Seventh
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates escape Garp's attack. They name their new ship "Thousand Sunny" and then sail on toward their next adventure. Smoker and Tashigi are seen on an unknown island, commenting on the Straw Hats' new bounties. In Arabasta, King Cobra, Pell, Igaram and Chaka are seen reading a newspaper about the Straw Hats. Vivi is seen, not bothered by the fact that her old enemy, Robin is now one of the Straw Hats.
cover: Color Spread: "Walk More Slowly."

title: Fire Fist vs Blackbeard
summary: The close friends of the members of the first six Straw Hat Pirates react to each of their different bounties. Meanwhile, the fight between Portgas D. Ace and Blackbeard rages on.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 10: "First Lieutenant Spacey, Beaten By a Space Pirate."

title: Duel on Banaro Island
summary: Ace and Marshall D. Teach fight on Banaro Island but the outcome of the battle is unknown.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 11: "No-Mercy Space Pirate".

title: Adventure in the Demonic Sea
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates enter Florian Triangle and meet a living skeleton: Brook, on a huge ghost ship.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 12: "Divine Judgment On the Nonbeliever".

title: Thriller Bark
summary: Brook comes onboard the Thousand Sunny, scares the Straw Hats and then talks with them. He has dinner with the Straw Hats and explains the crew the reason for his skeleton appearance and how a powerful person stole his shadow making him unable to leave the Florian Triangle.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 13: "The Big Bang".

title: Adventure on Ghost Island
summary: Nami, Usopp, and Chopper set foot on Thriller Bark thanks to Franky revealing the channels within the Sunny. The rest of the crew, meanwhile, are being attacked by an invisible beast on the Thousand Sunny. Nami's team encounters a cerberus on the island and runs away. They meet its owner who offers the trio to take them to Dr. Hogback's castle. Chopper is surprised by the name.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 14: "My Vearth! Wrath Absolute!!"

title: The Zombie
summary: Nami, Usopp, and Chopper venture further into Thriller Bark.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 15: "The Space Pirates' Lunar Excavation Scheme".

title: Doctor Hogback
summary: Nami, Usopp, and Tony Tony Chopper meet more people, and the rest of the Straw Hats disembark on Thriller Bark.
cover: Color Spread: "Viking."

title: Surprise Zombie
summary: Luffy successfully tames the Cerberus zombie. Afterwards, the group encounters a unicorn and an elderly tree having a picnic. Outside Hogback's mansion, Hogback, Absalom and Perona discuss the Straw Hat Pirates. Usopp, Nami and Chopper walk through the mansion and try to make sense of the mysterious phenomena they have encountered, when all of a sudden the paintings, wall decorations and floor rug come alive and attack them. They manage to escape through a secret exit in the fireplace and end up in a room filled with large photographs of a smiling Cindry without any stitches.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 16: "The Advent".

title: Moria
summary: Nami, Usopp, and Chopper run around the castle of Thriller Bark as the rest of the Straw Hats go deeper into Thriller Bark. They find out the person they are trying to beat is one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 17: "Flashback—Karakuri Island, the Day I Was Born".

title: The Mysterious Four of Thriller Bark
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates promise Spoil that they will help him get his shadow back. Meanwhile in Hogback's mansion, Usopp, Nami and Chopper witness the method of producing zombies. At a grave, Absalom is awakening some zombies who call him their 'leader'. Spoil reveals to the Straw Hats that Thriller Bark is the largest ship in the world. The Straw Hats then prepare to enter the mansion.
cover: Color Spread: Luffy, Nami, and Zoro, in formal black clothing, stand within the ruins of a castle and atop the coils of a great red dragon. All around, cherry blossoms are falling.

title: General Zombie Night
summary: In Hogback's mansion, Hogback finds Nami, Usopp, and Chopper and sends Ryuma, a samurai zombie who acts a lot like Brook to stop them. The rest of the Straw Hat Pirates enter the mansion and find themselves defeating a group of zombies. Buhichuck refuses to tell them where the missing trio is and Zoro suggest to take him as a guide. Meanwhile Absalom resurrects the General Zombies.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 18: "The Moon-Gazing Connoisseur Professor Tsukimi".

title: Perona's Wonder Garden
summary: Absalom orders the General Zombies to hunt down the Straw Hat Pirates. Then Lola the zombie asks Absalom to marry her, but Absalom tells her that he decided to make Nami his future wife. Nami, Usopp and Chopper are put on a coffin by Hogback but the coffin falls off and the trio manage to get out. Later they find themselves at Perona's 'Wonder Garden' and Inuppe, a penguin zombie, saves Nami from another zombie saying that even if he dies, he will not kick a woman. Meanwhile the rest of the Straw Hat Pirates are inside the mansion with Buhichuck being their guide. Zoro mysteriously disappears just like Sanji did before.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 19: "During the Moon-Gazing, A Lunar Explosion".

title: Jigorο of the Wind
summary: Strangely, Zoro disappeared, just like Sanji did before. Luffy, Robin and Franky keep searching for the remaining members of the crew. With Buhichuck as their guide, they end up in a room, and suddenly a strange person inside an armor attacks Franky. Franky defeats him, but not easily. Meanwhile Buhichuck leaves them laughing and says to Luffy that no one of his friends is safe. Inside the room, Luffy, Robin and Franky fight with the General Zombies.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 20: "Choked By A Moon-Gazing Dumping: A Tearful Parting".

title: Cloudy, Partly Bony
summary: Inuppe continues to defend Nami. Absalom then enters, being chased by Lola, who then carries Nami away. Nami then shocks him with a thunderbolt, making him stop. Lola then starts chasing Nami, and Inuppe challenges Absalom, but is easily defeated. Back at the bridge, Tararan tells Franky and Robin that Luffy, Zoro and Sanji were captured. They are then surrounded by zombies but Franky breaks the bridge and grapples the end of the bridge to safety. The chapter ends with Brook falling out of the sky.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 21: "To the Moon!"

title: Humming
summary: The chapter starts off with Lola chasing Nami. Nami then exclaims that she is in fact a man, which calms the zombie down. After making friends with it, Absalom appears but Lola starts chasing him so Nami can escape. Back at the Thousand Sunny, Perona is raiding the ship when Hildon appears to summon her to Moria. At the bridge, Franky and Robin battle Tararan, but are ultimately trapped in his web. Brook then makes an entrance and defeats Tararan in one slash.
cover: Color Spread: "Deadly Combat."

title: Gecko Moria of the Seven Warlords of the Sea
summary: Brook defeats Tararan the Spider Monkey. Brook explains to Franky and Nico Robin how the shadow is separated from the body and implanted in a corpse. Brook reveals that the Warlord of the Sea Gecko Moria has the Devil Fruit power of the Kage Kage no Mi. Moria only needs a shadow and a corpse to create a zombie. The zombie retains the powers of the original owner of the shadow. Moria seeks out those with huge bounties to take their shadows in order to make powerful zombies. Moria explains to Luffy that he was originally only after Luffy, Zoro and Sanji. Moria cuts Luffy's shadow from him.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 22: "Avenge the Professor! Time For A Man To Do What A Man's Gotta Do!"

title: Demon from the Land of Ice
summary: Brook explains about shadows and reveals that the zombies' weak point is salt. He then goes into explaining about his past (off screen). Back at the mansion, Luffy's shadow has been taken and Moria and Hogback discuss about putting the shadow into 'Number 900'. Before they enter the chamber where 'Number 900' is held, they learn about the intruders. Nami, Chopper and Usopp remain in Kumashi. Back at the bridge, the General Zombie are looking for Franky and Robin, but they are already gone and running up a flight of stairs. In Hogback's lab, Brook meets his zombie, Ryuma. At the mansion, Moria and his subordinates head into the chamber and 'Number 900' is revealed.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 23: "O Woe! Too Strong Were the Space Pirates".

title: Meeeeat!!!
summary: Oars is awakened through Luffy's shadow. Nami, Usopp and Chopper's position is revealed and they try to escape, but are pursued by Absalom. Absalom easily defeats Usopp and Chopper and captures Nami in the process. Usopp and Chopper are then surrounded by zombies and are outnumbered but Robin and Franky come in to save them.
cover: Color Spread: Dressed as outlaws, Robin, Chopper, Usopp, Luffy, and Sanji (the latter two riding a giant lizard) enter an Old West town.

title: Anything but My Afro
summary: Usopp, Chopper, Franky and Robin run down a huge stairway while discussing about what had happened. Back at the mansion, Oars eats lots of food and tells Moria he does not want to become his subordinate and wants to become the Pirate King, breaking through the freezer. In Hogback's lab, Brook and the zombie, Ryuma who has his shadow continue their conversation and soon after, Brook starts dueling with Ryuma for his shadow. Then, Absalom is shown lying Nami onto a table and telling his subordinate to begin the wedding ceremony. Usopp, Chopper, Franky and Robin runs back to the ship and find it looted. Usopp finds Luffy, Zoro and Sanji and wakes them up.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 24: "God's Judgment".

title: Being Dead Isn't an Apology
summary: Luffy, Zoro and Sanji wake up to find their shadows gone, and learn that Nami and most of the food on the ship have been taken as well. While Brook is fighting Ryuma, Franky tells the rest of the Straw Hats of his and Robin's encounter with the skeleton, in which Brook explained that his sole reason for living alone for fifty years was to fulfill a promise his crew made to their friend Laboon; that they would return after sailing around the world. Hearing that Brook and Laboon have not given up on their promise even after fifty years makes Luffy even more excited to make Brook join his crew, and this time the rest of the Straw Hats happily agree. Filled with purpose, the Straw Hats get ready to begin their counterattack.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 25: "No Way Out, Space Pirates".

title: Get Back Before Dawn!!
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates set out across Thriller Bark, looking to retrieve their shadows, rescue Nami, and retrieve their food and treasures before dawn. As they progress towards the mansion, Perona mobilizes her ghosts as Luffy's zombie, the giant Oars, begins to explore Thriller Bark.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 26: "Such Insolence!!"

title: Ghost Buster
summary: Usopp starts the fight with Perona.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 27: "For Avenging the Professor, Our Undying Gratitude".

title: Adventures of Oars
summary: Usopp continues his fight of negativity with Perona. Meanwhile, Brook continues his duel with Ryuma, but is defeated. Franky and Zoro save Brook from Ryuma, later resulting in Zoro challenging Ryuma to a battle. In the cathedral Absalom continues his wedding with Nami. Oars's adventure results in the shaking of Thriller Bark and defeat of all the General Zombies.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 28: "Strike Now, Ask Later".

title: Pirate Sanji vs Mysterious Absalom
summary: Luffy confronts Gecko Moria in an attempt to recover the shadows he stole. Moria nonchalantly sits back as his own shadow, Doppelman easily defends against all of Luffy's attacks. Inside the chapel, Sanji recovers Nami and battles Absalom, furious at him for having licked Nami and Robin. After he literally explodes with anger, Sanji tells Absalom that he has another reason to be annoyed at him.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 29: "What the Space Pirates Have Excavated".

title: Sanji's Dream
summary: Absalom is beaten hopelessly by Sanji for stealing his dream, which was to eat the Suke Suke no Mi so he could become be an invisible man and sneak into women showers and see them naked.
cover: Color Spread: "WANTED: 667,000,050."

title: Pirate Usopp vs Princess Perona
summary: Usopp battles with Perona, and his arsenal proves ineffective against her ability. On the contrary, she is quite capable of causing Usopp damage, and Kumashi re-enters the fray. Usopp calls on "Sogeking", who helps restore his confidence and point out a critical weakness of Perona.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 30: "What Slumbers Beneath the Moon's Terrain".

title: Conclusion
summary: Usopp has finally seen through Perona's tricks, and uses a fake hammer that weighs 10 tons to beat Perona. Zoro challenges the samurai Ryuma, and their battle begins in earnest.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 31: "Within the Darkness, An Underground City".

title: Pirate Zoro vs Samurai Ryuma
summary: Roronoa Zoro combats the samurai Ryuma using One-Sword Style and Two-Sword Style. The intensity of the battle causes the destruction of Dr. Hogback's laboratory, moving the fight to the roof of the tower. Franky and Brook watch on as Zoro defeats Ryuma using "One Sword Style: Hiryu: Kaen". Brook finally receives his shadow back, and Zoro acquires a new katana, the Shusui.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 32: "Strike (the City) Now, Ask Later".

title: Pirate Chopper vs Mysterious Hogback
summary: Chopper continues to argue with Hogback about human life. Chopper and Robin engage in battle with Cindry and Hogback, while Zoro and Sanji's zombies are defeated.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 33: "The Ancient City Surges With Energy".

title: Come Out Here, Straw Hat Pirates!!!
summary: Hogback regains the control of Cindry and makes her attack Robin and Chopper. Robin stops Cindry as Hogback tries to escape. Robin and Chopper try to finish off Hogback, but Oars interrupts them. Oars destroys some building which Usopp and Sanji were in. Sanji loses Nami, who is kidnapped by Absalom once again. Oars provokes the Straw Hats to come out and fight him.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 34: "Charge Complete!! Thanks to the Destroyer".

title: Oars vs. Straw Hat Pirates
summary: Luffy chases after Gecko Moria, and the rest of the Straw Hats (except Nami) face off against Oars. However, Oars's brute strength and speed prove to be too much for the Straw Hats to handle, as the giant zombie evades and shrugs off their attacks while defeating every one of them, seemingly without exerting any effort.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 35: "A Study In Murals: Long Ago, Winged Men Walked the Moon..."

title: My Friend
summary: Nami wakes up and defeats Absalom with Lola's help. Meanwhile the rest of the Straw Hats prepare to take on Oars once more.
cover: Color Spread: The Straw Hat Pirates explore an undersea ruin, most of them riding on colorful manta rays. Countless other sea creatures swirl about, from octopi to dolphins to whales.

title: Down
summary: Jumping into the courtyard, Oars confronts the Straw Hat Pirates. Wondering how they could take down the giant zombie, Oars attempts to crush them with his own creative technique. Avoiding this, Franky announces they should use Tactics Fifteen. This however fails as Robin refuses to join in. Following up with a series of combination techniques, the Straw Hat Pirates succeed in knocking down Oars by attacking each limb separately and stunning the zombie. Watching from afar; the zombies refuse to acknowledge the idea of somebody being able to take down Oars. Back inside the mansion, Nami had successfully escaped Absalom and finds the treasure room empty. Going to the Thousand Sunny, several zombies at the command of Perona are loading the ship with supplies as she plans to escape the chaos unfolding on the island; only for her to be stopped by the surprise arrival of the Warlord Bartholomew Kuma.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 36: "The Name of That Moon City was Birka. When It Ran Fallow, They Set Out for the Blue Star".

title: Warlord Bartholomew Kuma Appears
summary: Nami races towards the Sunny and tries to save the ship and the treasure. The Straw Hats gain an advantage over Oars. The Warlord of the Sea, Bartholomew Kuma appears, looking for both Moria and Luffy. He also makes Perona "disappear", to everyone's terror. Meanwhile, Luffy fights Moria's shadow.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Vol. 37: "All Around, A Horde of Loyal Followers and an Endless Stretch of Vearth".

title: We Have To Do It!
summary: Moria's shadow leaves Luffy in the forest. Meanwhile Zoro battles Oars in the castle courtyard while the other Straw Hats watch. He is stopped by Usopp who informs him that even if he beats Oars they would only get Luffy's shadow back, but if Luffy defeats Moria they will all get their shadows at once. Zoro in turn states that getting at least Luffy's shadow back is their best bet at this time.
cover: Enel's Great Space Operations, Conclusion: "Full Power! The Enel Army Stands Tall!!"

title: Pirates of the Forest
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates battle Moria who is controlling Oars' body. Meanwhile, the Risky Brothers offer to tell Luffy the secret of Moria's powers as well as giving him a secret power to defeat him.
cover: Animal Theater: Working as DJs for a pirate radio station, Luffy and a boar sort through a stack of song requests.

title: Nightmare Luffy
summary: The captain of the Rolling Pirates, Lola explains the current situation to Luffy involving Moria and his crew. Before Luffy can run off again, the pirates bring out and implant him with a shadow they had captured which imbues Luffy with the abilities of a skilled swordsman. Explaining the powers behind the shadows, the Rolling Pirates bring out all the shadows they have captured and begin putting them inside Luffy. Back in the mansion's courtyard, Oars continues to control the fight with his newly gifted stretching abilities. Questioning how the zombie is stretching all of a sudden, Moria explains that by changing the shape of a person's shadow he can control their body's shape. Further fighting results in Brook being knocked unconscious but luckily, Robin manages to stop Oars' stretching by attacking Moria directly.
cover: Animal Theater: Sanji buys fresh cabbages from the hard-working lizards of the Salamander Farm.

title: ⅜
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates continue their battle with Moria and Oars.
cover: Animal Theater: Usopp builds an elaborate hang-glider to soar along a trio of birds.

title: Luffy vs. Luffy
summary: With the Straw Hats besides Nami and Usopp defeated, hope is lost until Luffy, powered up, returns to battle Gecko Moria and Oars.
cover: Animal Theater: Nami is decked out for the big cross-country race. Her vehicle of choice: a top-of-the-line, all-terrain tortoise.

title: Warrior of Hope
summary: Nightmare Luffy is beating Oars over and over and finally takes him down.
cover: Animal Theater: Franky holds a dance class with a troop of orangutans, centered on his trademark "SUPER!" pose.

title: Interception
summary: As Oars is not defeated just yet, the Straw Hats recover to land a massive combined attack, immobilizing the giant for good.
cover: Animal Theater: Some friendly penguins help Chopper build his very own totem pole, consisting of Chopper atop four penguins atop a skua atop a fox atop a polar bear.

title: Shadow's Asgard
summary: Oars is finally defeated but Moria, to everyone's surprise, is still alive and he starts to taking all the shadows off Thriller Bark with the attack Shadows Asgard, absorbing one thousand shadows in his body. The sun is rising and the Straw Hat Pirates have to defeat Moria to take all the shadows back before the sun can fully rise or they will turn to ash.
cover: Animal Theater: Zoro practices calligraphy (with, naturally, the character for sword (剣, sword?)) under the watchful eye of his feline sensei.

title: Morning Is Coming
summary: Morning is about to come and Moria is still alive with all the shadows. Luffy activates Gear 2 and Gear 3 simultaneously and he does some serious damage to Moria, forcing some of the shadows coming out from his body.
cover: Animal Theater: In a freezing land, several jealous birds in ragtag hats and scarves accost Robin over her pristine clothes.

title: The End of The Dream
summary: Luffy made it: he finally defeated Gecko Moria and now the shadows are returning to their original bodies. The Straw Hats are now resting but another unexpected Warlord of the Sea, Bartholomew Kuma appears with a mission from World Government to destroy the Straw Hats.
cover: Color Spread: "The Law of the Blue."

title: Squish
summary: Bartholomew Kuma battles with the Straw Hat Pirates.
cover: Animal Theater: In a grove of giant lilypads, Vivi plays a harp, while a pair of toads sing backup.

title: Straw Hat Pirates - Pirate Hunter Zoro
summary: Thriller Bark is still floating, but everything on it is destroyed. Kuma starts walking towards Luffy and grabs him, but is immediately stopped and cut on the shoulder by Zoro. The shoulder appears to have metallic parts, before Kuma shoots a laser beam at Zoro which explodes as it makes contact with the ground. Kuma reveals that he is a superior type of cyborg. Zoro begs for Kuma to spare Luffy's life and take his instead. Sanji wakes up and comes to Kuma insisting that his life should be the one taken. Zoro knocks out Sanji and Kuma agrees to not take Luffy's life. He repels all of Luffy's pain and fatigue into a giant paw-shaped sphere. Zoro enters it before everyone wakes up and Luffy feels better, much to everyone's surprise. Sanji goes out to look for Zoro and find him covered in blood.
cover: Animal Theater: Karoo and the rest of the Super Spot-Billed Duck Troops (including Matsuge) go fishing, only to all catch the exact same thing: a very angry eel.

title: Piano
summary: While the Thriller Bark gang not including Perona escape, the Straw Hats and Rolling Pirates celebrate their victory over Moria. Sanji learns what happened to Zoro and Brook learns that Laboon is still alive.
cover: Where They Are Now, Shot 4: "Yokozuna Challenges the Sea Train No Longer."

title: That Song
summary: Brook has a flashback from 50 years ago when the Rumbar Pirates first encountered Laboon. His crew tried to make Laboon return to his pod, but he didn't listen and followed them to the Grand Line. They stayed at the Twin capes for three months and then left Laboon with Crocus. The skeleton recalls bits of his adventures with his former crew. Eventually, his captain Yorki, contacts an incurable illness and tries to leave the Grand Line through the Calm Belt.
cover: Where They Are Now, Shot 5: "Iceburg's Secretary Audition."

title: Song of Life
summary: Brook continues to have flashbacks. This time, he recounts his crew dying. However, they still sing the Binks' Sake song which they record on a tone dial for Laboon as their last great performance thus keeping their promise to Laboon. The Binks' Sake song lyrics is fully showed in this chapter.
cover: Where They Are Now, Shot 6: "Galley-La’s Vice President Paulie, With Fans and Sharks."

title: The Eighth
summary: Brook becomes the newest crew member of the Straw Hat Pirates. The crew rejoices over having a musician join the crew. Brook reminisces about the Laboon. At the same time, in Twin Cape, Laboon seems to be unusually filled with joy, as noted by Crocus. Brook bids his crew a final farewell at a grave that Franky built. Zoro also joins him as he says goodbye to his old katana. Luffy announces that the crew will be heading to Fish-Man Island next. Lola gives Nami a piece of her mother's vivre card. She tells Nami that it will come in handy for them in the New World. Luffy then remembers that his brother gave him a vivre card back in Arabasta. He takes out the card and notices that it is burning and smaller than before. Lola, alarmed, tells Luffy that his brother's life force is fading away and that he is in danger.
cover: Color Spread: Usopp and Franky build a treehouse atop a tree coiling into a sea of clouds. While the rest of the Straw Hats are content to rest there, Luffy, Chopper, and Brook notice all the goldfish floating around the clouds—and step into the air to see if they can float as well.

title: Arriving Again
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates leave Thriller Bark and arrive at the Red Line. There, they meet and rescue a mermaid, Camie.
cover: Where They Are Now, Shot 7: "Oimo and Kashii, Elbaf-Bound."

title: Flying Fish Riders
summary: The Straw Hats introduce themselves to Camie and Pappag. Camie receives a call through the Den Den Mushi and learns her friend Hachi has been kidnapped by pirate fish-man Macro. Camie uses her ability to be able to speak with fish and navigates the ship towards Grove 44 of the Sabaody Archipelago until they are attacked by Flying Fish Riders.
cover: CP9's Independent Report, Vol. 1: "Isle of Zero Survivors".

title: Iron Mask Duval
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates meet more of the Flying Fish Riders while they attempt to save Hatchan.
cover: CP9's Independent Report, Vol. 2: "Air Door".

title: You Know Me
summary: As the Straw Hat Pirates battle the Flying Fish Riders, Hatchan is freed from imprisonment and defeats the Macro Pirates. When Luffy attempts to hijack a flying fish, he ends up crashing into Duval's room and seeing the masked man's face.
cover: CP9's Independent Report, Vol. 3: "Save Rob Lucci".

title: Duval's Tragedy
summary: The Straw Hats continue to fight against the Flying Fish Riders. Duval says he has a personal issue with Sanji while the Straw Hats are confused by this statement as they never met the man before. Luffy then suddenly knock off Duval's mask, revealing his face, which surprisingly resembles the poorly drawn picture on Sanji's wanted poster. Everyone looks at Duval's face, commenting at how much the face look a lot similar to the poorly drawn picture on Sanji's wanted poster.
cover: CP9's Independent Report, Vol. 4: "Forced Error—Pursued By the World Government".

title: Gaon Cannon
summary: Sanji and Duval argue about the face on Sanji's bounty poster, then Duval tells Sanji about his history. Afterwards, Duval shoots at Sanji with his harpoon gun in rage, but fails to hit him. He then orders two riders to drag Sanji into the water and drown him with a steel net. Camie leaps into the water and attempts to rescue Sanji. Meanwhile, the other riders attempts to use a giant anchor to sink the Thousand Sunny and drown the rest of the Straw Hat Pirates, especially those with Devil Fruit abilities. Franky, however, controls the ship and manages to escape the anchor with Chicken Voyage and then fights back with the Gaon Cannon, blasting away most of the riders. Duval's pet bison, Motobaro, attempts to attack the crew but is stopped by Luffy when he unintentionally uses Haoshoku Haki. Duval then fights on his own and attempts to kill Sanji again with the harpoon gun, but Sanji evades them and starts to attack Duval's face. He then finishes Duval off with a very strong kick into the face.
cover: CP9's Independent Report, Vol. 5: "The Escape Track".

title: Yarukiman Mangrove
summary: The Takoyaki 8 crew prepares food for the Straw Hats. Duval comes to thank Sanji for re-constructing his face. Pappag explains to the Straw Hats how to get to New World. After the group arrives at Sabaody Archipelago, Hatchan warns the Straw Hats not to get involved with the World Nobles.
cover: CP9's Independent Report, Vol. 6: "In St. Poplar, Town of the Spring Queen, Without Any Hospital Money".

title: Adventure on the Archipelago of Dancing Soap Bubbles
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates happily explore Sabaody Archipelago until they encounter the Celestial Dragons.
cover: CP9's Independent Report, Vol. 7: "To Save Rob Lucci: Kumadori Showboats For Medical Fees".

title: The Eleven Supernovas
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates arrive at Shakky's Rip-off Bar, after managing to get to Grove 13. There, they inquire about Rayleigh. Shakky informs the Straw Hat Pirates about the Eleven Supernovas, a group of rookie pirates with bounties of over 100,000,000 that arrived at Sabaody Archipelago at the same time.
cover: CP9's Independent Report, Vol. 8: "Showboating For Medical Fees: Jabra & Blueno's Wild Animal Show".

title: Sabaody Park
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates arrive at Sabaody Park where Camie gets kidnapped by a team of kidnappers.
cover: CP9's Independent Report, Vol. 9: "Showboating For Medical Fees: The Giraffe Slide".

title: The Embers of History
summary: Luffy, Hatchan and Pappag search for Camie, who was kidnapped. Meanwhile Sanji, Usopp, and Franky get help from the Rosy Life Riders in searching for the kidnapped Camie and also reuniting the Straw Hats. The chapter ends with an old enslaved man being introduced as the First Mate of the Roger Pirates, Silvers Rayleigh.
cover: CP9's Independent Report, Vol. 10: "Working For Medical Fees: Scrubbing the Town Clean".

title: The World Begins to Swell
summary: Garp receives word that Silvers Rayleigh is to be sold at the Human Auctioning House, but decides to ignore the report, and orders the Marine officer to keep it quiet. Meanwhile, on the Sabaody Archipelago, Sanji arrives at the Auction House meets up with some of the Straw Hats. However, Luffy, Zoro, Robin and Brook are still on their way to the Auction House.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 11: "We'll Gladly Accept Your Soaked Cash".

title: The Incident of the Celestial Dragons
summary: Luffy angers the Celestial Dragons by attacking one, thus consequently summoning an Admiral to the Sabaody Archipelago.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 12: "Shopping and Smoking".

title: Aggravated Island
summary: Monkey D. Luffy starts an uproar in the Human Auctioning House by punching Saint Charlos. All the Straw Hat Pirates gather at the auction house. Silvers Rayleigh escapes with a giant and meets Luffy, stating that he had wanted to meet Luffy.
cover: Color spread: The Straw Hats are partying in a mushroom world.

title: Pirate Front Line on the Move!!
summary: News of the assault on the World Nobles quickly spreads around the Sabaody Archipelago. The other six Supernovas immediately begin to escape the island before the admiral's arrival. In Mary Geoise, news arrives about the Celestial Dragon incident and an admiral volunteers to go to Sabaody Archipelago. Disco calls Donquixote Doflamingo for help, since the Auction House is owned by him, but Doflamingo tells Disco that slavery is old news and never to call him again. He also mentions that all of the Shichibukai are assembling for a great battle to come. Silvers Rayleigh frees Camie from her explosive collar. Luffy, Law and Kid battle against the Marines.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 13: "Waiting for the Shoppers".

title: Kuma
summary: Monkey D. Luffy, Eustass Kid, and Trafalgar Law fight off Marines. Law and Kid are revealed to be Devil Fruit users. Luffy, Law, and Kid emerge from the battle with the Marines, victorious. Kid states that Luffy, Law and Kid will meet up in the New World again, to which they agree on. Law invites Jean Bart to join his crew, the Heart Pirates to which Jean accept.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 14: "The Awakening".

title: Roger and Rayleigh
summary: The Heart Pirates begin to retreat from the Human Auction House until Law notices the Kid Pirates fighting against the Shichibukai Bartholomew Kuma. Duval defeats the leader of Hound Pets, Peterman. Silvers Rayleigh tells Luffy and the Straw Hat Pirates about his connection to the late Gol D. Roger and their past.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 15: "Discharged From the Hospital"

title: Kizaru Arrives
summary: The Straw Hat Pirates converse with Rayleigh and Shakky at Shakky's Rip-off Bar. Admiral Kizaru arrives in response to the assault on the Celestial Dragon. Elsewhere on the Saboady Archipelago, several of the Supernovas are confronted by Marine forces and they reveal their abilities.
cover: Color spread: Straw Hats' Declaration of War.

title: Island of Carnage
summary: The Eleven Supernovas are fighting Marines, and show their abilities. Meanwhile, the Straw Hat Pirates are fighting a Pacifista, a weapon made by the World Government.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 16: "Everybody has Fun Bowling".

title: Kizaru vs. Four Captains
summary: As Brook, Franky and Usopp fled from the man's attacks, they wondered about his weapons. The man then shot a laser at Luffy, but he avoided it, and together with Sanji and Zoro, the three used their strongest attacks on the man. The rest of the Straw Hat Pirates cheered them on, but Luffy, Sanji and Zoro realized it is not Bartholomew Kuma, as they originally thought. Meanwhile on Grove 24, Urouge attacked another Bartholomew Kuma and gained the upper hand of the fight. Basil Hawkins is surprised at how a weak man can suddenly become so powerful and wondered how Urouge is able to do so. Suddenly, the man shot a laser at Urouge, shocking X Drake, as he wondered of Vegapunk and how the scientist reproduced Kizaru's fighting ability.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 17: "Ruckus in the Town"

title: Straw Hat Crew vs. Combat Weapon
summary: Kizaru has defeated 3 of the Supernovas. The Straw Hats finally after so much effort, defeated "Kuma".
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 18: "The Candy Pirates Appear in St. Poplar Harbor".

title: Axe-Carrying Sentomaru
summary: After PX-4 was defeated, Sentomaru appeared with another Pacifista. The Straw Hats are exhausted and fatigued from the previous fight, so they are forced to flee. They split into three teams. Luffy tells everyone to regroup at the Sunny in three days' time. Nami's group gets chased by the PX-1, and Luffy's group deals with Sentomaru. Meanwhile, Zoro gets gravely injured by the Marine Admiral, Kizaru. The crew tries to save him, but their attacks are ineffective against his Pika Pika no Mi abilities. Just when all seemed lost, Rayleigh intervenes at the last second and saves Zoro by stopping Kizaru's kick with his own. He tells the admiral that these youngsters' era is just beginning.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 19: "Envoy of Justice".

title: Zoro, Gone
summary: Rayleigh and Kizaru clash. The Straw Hats try to escape, but they are being pursued by Sentomaru and the PX-1. Chopper eats another rumble ball within a short time frame and loses control. The real Bartholomew Kuma appears before Zoro's group. He asks Zoro where he would like to go on a trip to before making him vanish into thin air.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 20: "Strength the Likes of Which Has Never Been Seen".

title: Beyond Rescue!!!
summary: The Straw Hats vanish one by one, Kuma having defeated them completely.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 21: "Excessive Justice".

title: Mushrooms-Grow-From-the-Body Mushroom
summary: Duval and the others are guarding the Thousand Sunny at Grove #41 waiting for the Straw Hats to return. At the auction house the marines try to calm an angry Shalria who is upset by the terrible condition her father and brother are in thanks to the Straw Hat Pirates. The marines assure her that admiral Kizaru will take care of things. Back at Shakky's bar, Camie expresses concern over the Straw Hats' safety. Hatchan assures her that their friends are strong and they will make it through this, but Shakky rebuts by saying that their friends are not strong enough to take on an admiral yet. Meanwhile Luffy finds himself on a mysterious island. He is determined to reunite with his crew. As he runs through the dense jungle Luffy recalls the moment he and his crew were separated, haunted by the fact that he was unable to save even one member of his crew. He then collides head on with a wall, knocking himself back and making him use his gigantic pistol to destroy it. Feeling drained, Luffy decides to feast on a random boar and some mushrooms. The mushrooms turn out to be poisonous and incapacitate Luffy as they grow all over his body. He is later found by members of the Kuja tribe and they take them back to their village to treat him mistaking him for a she. The Kuja tribe is able to successfully able to treat Luffy, but are shocked to later learn that he is of masculine origins having never seen a man before on the all female island of Amazon Lily.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 22: "We Cannot Remain in this Town".

title: Adventure on the Island of Women
summary: Luffy finally awakens and finds himself naked and in solitary confinement. As the citizens gather to see him, Kikyo tries to execute Luffy with her haki imbued arrows. Luffy escapes his cell and avoids being recaptured. He decides to take Marguerite along with him for questioning. After escaping into the jungle, Luffy gets his vivre card back from Marguerite and learns that the empress of Amazon Lily is also a pirate.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 23: "Too Beautiful to Behold, A Flower of Thanks".

title: Pirate Empress Boa Hancock
summary: While thinking of a way to get off Amazon Lily, Luffy attempts to find a way to travel but quickly learns that such is impossible for him. Suddenly, he is attacked by the women of the island, seeking to eliminate him as their empress has returned. Out at sea, Boa Hancock refuses to answer the call of the World Government to attend a Seven Warlords of the Sea meeting and instead turns the Marines into stone, with the exception of Vice Admiral Momonga, who tells her that if she does not answer the call, she will lose her Warlord status.
cover: Color Spread: The Straw Hat Pirates during their corresponding introductions.

title: Bathing
summary: After returning from sea, Hancock is approached by Elder Nyon who asks her to reconsider the rejection of the World Government's call before being thrown out as Hancock prepares to take a bath. A pirate explains the history of Hancock and why everyone must not look at her when she removes her clothes due to a curse put on her. Meanwhile, Luffy looks for a ship to use and decides to see one on the tallest building, that building being the palace, the roof of which he crashes into and lands in Hancock's bathhouse, much to her wrath.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 24: "CP9 Departs from St. Poplar".

title: The Arena
summary: Hancock, Marigold, and Sandersonia confront Luffy after the pirate broke into Hancock's bath and saw the mark on her back. Hancock uses her devil fruit to try to turn Luffy to stone, but it somehow does not work. Luffy is driven out of the palace, where he is captured by the Kuja Tribe and placed in an arena where he is to be executed.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 25: "Homeland"

title: A King's Disposition
summary: Boa Marigold and Boa Sandersonia use their Zoan Devil Fruit powers to attack Luffy in the arena, and they also use Haki to avoid his attacks and bypass his rubber body to hurt him. When Luffy insults a jeering Hancock, the Gorgon Sisters decide to shatter the petrified Marguerite to punish him. However, Luffy unwittingly stops them by unleashing Haoshoku Haki, a one-in-a-million ability whose users are stated to have a king's disposition, and prepares to get serious in the fight.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 26: "The Next Generation of Cipher Pol in Training".

title: Eye of the Gorgon
summary: Luffy uses Gear 2, as the audience are surprised at the smoke coming out of Luffy. Sandersonia attempts to attack Luffy, but he is too fast for her to hit him. Luffy successfully hits Sandersonia and Marigold, which prompts Hancock to ask what they are playing at. Sandersonia and Marigold start attacking Luffy again with their strongest attacks, but he launches his "Jet Gatling" attack, and proceed on to tying their snake tails together. The sisters panic, helpless, and Sandersonia nearly falls off the arena and the clothes on her back are burned off. However, Luffy covers her back in order to hide her slave mark, much to her shock. Hancock, realizing the severe situation, orders the audience in the area to leave. Sandersonia questions Luffy on why would he help her, and Luffy shows his kindred heart, causing Hancock to cry.
cover: Color spread: The Straw Hat Pirates playing a game of cards while snacking on apple-oranges and watermelon-bananas.

title: Hoof of the Celestial Dragon
summary: Luffy is granted two choices: either free Sweet Pea, Marguerite, and Aphelandra from Boa Hancock's Mero Mero Mellow or he can get a ship and sail away, because he blocked Boa Sandersonia's slave symbol. He chooses to free them and is sent to the Kuja palace, where Boa Hancock shows him her slave symbol. After hearing from Nyon that Luffy assaulted a World Noble, Hancock, realizing she can trust him, tells him her shameful past as a slave and how she and her sisters were liberated by Fisher Tiger. When asked if Luffy hates her now that he knows she was a slave, Luffy says he does not and only hates the World Nobles and Hancock smiles stating she likes him and will give him a ship to get off the island.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 27: "Pursuers Arrive to Capture CP9".

title: Fatal Illness
summary: Hancock promises Luffy a ship and decides to let him join the Kujas at a banquet. Luffy behaves as his usual self and parties with them as the Kuja' marvel at Luffy's rubber body. As he eats they start poking and stretching him, angrily telling them he is not a side attraction and they give chase to him and Luffy runs away and escapes with Marguerite, who then thanks Luffy for saving her and her friends. They both arrive at Nyon's house where Luffy discovers Hancock's title of Shichibukai, the war with the Whitebeard Pirates and his brother's execution. Luffy asks for a way to save him and Nyon says only a Marine ship can make it to the prison he is at on time, Impel Down, and Hancock would have to use her title to make it. Luffy makes the tough decision to save his brother rather than to reunite with his crew. Nyon and Luffy see Hancock, who is revealed to have gotten sick and Nyon says she knows the sickness and tells her Luffy wishes to see her and Hancock does despite her illness. Luffy asks if she can board the Marine ship to save Ace, much to her sister's fury, thinking he's taking advantage of her. However, Hancock surprisingly agrees, much to her family's shock as Nyon says her disease is called "Love Sickness" and Hancock has fallen in love with Luffy.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 28: "We Won't Let You Disturb Our Home".

title: Hell
summary: Nyon helps explain to Hancock her Love Sickness and how it killed past empresses and if Hancock goes with Luffy she will survive and Hancock realizes her love for Luffy. Luffy and Hancock set off for the Marine Headquarters. Garp has traveled to Impel Down to speak with Ace, before his execution. Nami has been sent to a Sky Island called Weatheria. Franky has landed on an island where Vegapunk was born. Sanji has been sent to an Okama kingdom which he calls Hell.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 29: "Spandam in his Intensive Care Unit Receives a Den Den Mushi".

title: No One Can Stop This Now
summary: The scattered Straw Hat Pirates explore their new terrains while Luffy and Hancock move closer to Impel Down. As Marineford prepares for war, a meeting of the Shichibukai takes place and Garp visits Ace in Impel Down.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 30: "This is Your Former Subordinate, Rob Lucci".

title: The Underwater Prison Impel Down
summary: Garp visits Ace in Impel Down and talks to him about the future he intended for him. Meanwhile, Boa Hancock approaches Impel Down with a hidden Luffy.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 31: "Someday We Shall Return"

title: Adventure in the Great Prison
summary: Luffy and Hancock arrive at Impel Down and are greeted by Hannyabal and Domino. Luffy manages to sneak past the guards and proceeds down the prison's levels, meeting Buggy along the way.
cover: Color spread: A Yakuza tattoo of the original three Straw Hat Pirates: Monkey D. Luffy, Roronoa Zoro, and Nami.

title: Level 1 Crimson Hell
summary: Luffy and Buggy team up to save Ace in exchange for Luffy's armband. They face off against Blugori, guards, and enter Impel Down level 1: Crimson Hell.
cover: CP9's Independent Report Vol. 32: "Father and Son Plot the Obliteration of CP9"

title: Jinbe, Knight of the Sea
summary: Luffy and Buggy fight their way through Level Two of Impel Down and meet Mr. 3 along the way. The Chief Warden of Impel Down, Magellan, appears to escort Hancock to Ace's cell, who is talking to the Shichibukai Jinbe.
cover: CP9's Independent Report (Final) Vol. 33: "The Ship Sails off Into Distance"

title: Level 2 Wild Beast Hell
summary: Jinbe informs Ace about the protection Whitebeard has given to Fish-Man Island and many other locations, and states his desire to escape in order to stop the war. Luffy, Buggy, and Mr. 3 encounter the sphinx and fall down into Level 3.
cover: Straw Hats and Animals: Luffy is riding on the back of a beetle at night. The beetle apparently has lights coming from its eyes.

title: From One Hell to Another
summary: Luffy, Buggy, and Mr. 3 manage to defeat the sphinx and break through the floor to Level 3, and meet Mr. 2 there. At Marineford, Garp curses Luffy for entering Impel Down at the brink of war.
cover: Straw Hats and Animals: Usopp is standing on a rock next to praying mantis while trying to imitate its moves.

title: Level 3 Starvation Hell
summary: Boa Hancock meets Ace while Luffy battles on to save Ace, meeting up with Mr. 2 Bon Kurei in the process.
cover: Straw Hats and Animals: Chopper is holding a flag while a crab helps him by holding a picture of a pirate ship.

title: Jailer Beast Minotaurus
summary: Luffy and Bon Kurei reunite with Buggy and Mr. 3 only to come face to face with one of the Jailer Beasts of Impel Down.
cover: Color spread: the Shichibukai.

title: Level 4 Inferno Hell
summary: Luffy and his allies proceed into Level 4 as Magellan and the rest of Impel Down prepares for confrontation.
cover: Straw Hats and Animals: Sanji and a goat sit on a snowy roof UFO gazing.

title: Chief Warden Magellan vs. Pirate Luffy
summary: Luffy refuses to stand down against Magellan, but is at a disadvantage as he struggles with the warden using the Doku Doku no Mi to unleash poison attacks. Bentham decides to run away from Luffy, while Buggy and Galdino take the opportunity to try to beat Hannyabal and get back to Level 3.
cover: Straw Hats and Animals: A miniaturized Nami dances with a grasshopper while ants, who are gathering food, cheer in the background.

title: Friend
summary: Luffy is defeated by Magellan and thrown into Level Five while Mr. 2 plans to rescue his friend. Meanwhile, Ace asks about the situation, but is rejected.
cover: Straw Hats and Animals: Brook lifts weights alongside a muscular monkey.

title: Level 5 Frozen Hell
summary: After learning that it is impossible to create an antidote to all of the poisons Luffy has taken, Bentham decides that the only way to save him is to find Ivankov, the miracle worker. Masquerading as Hannyabal, Bentham proceeds to Level 5 with Buggy and Galdino and manages to break Luffy out of his cell. However, the two are attacked by wolves and faint, only to be found by a mysterious figure.
cover: Straw Hats and Animals: Franky fits an alpaca with special armor resembling a tank.

title: Okama in Hell
summary: As Impel Down searches for Mr. 2 and recovers from the recent incident, Bentham meets Emporio Ivankov and finds out that Luffy is undergoing excruciating treatment to heal being poisoned. Mr. 2 appears as Nami, but it was just to trick Hannyabal.
cover: Color spread: The Straw Hat Pirates having a dinner on a floating elephant.

title: Level 5.5 Newkama Land
summary: Ivankov raises Luffy's chances of survival with his Horu Horu no Mi. As Luffy struggles to withstand the violent treatment, the Revolutionary tells Mr. 2 about the infamous Level Six, Shiryu, and the existence of Level 5.5. To everyone's surprise, Luffy then attempts to break out of the treatment room after not even one day, despite the length of treatment being much more than that.
cover: Straw Hats and Animals: Zoro saves a chicken mom and her eggs from a striped wolf while asking for an egg in return. Note his t-shirt, which reads that he likes eggs.

title: Emporio Tension Hormone
summary: After being awakened, Luffy regains his strength through food and is joined on his quest to save Ace by Ivankov and Inazuma, members of the Revolutionary Army. At the same time, Ace is moved towards the main entrance of Impel Down for transport to Marineford.
cover: Straw Hats and Animals: Robin is sitting and relaxing in a field playing with butterflies.

title: Level 6 Eternal Hell
summary: Ivankov, Inazuma and Luffy realize Ace is not in his cell and release Jinbe and Crocodile in order to help them escape Impel Down, as well as fight in the upcoming war. Ace is being transported to the Marines.
cover: Color spread: Robin reads a bedtime story aloud for the Straw Hat Pirates and various animals. Zoro, Luffy and Franky fall asleep while Usopp, Nami, Sanji and Chopper are enjoying the story. Brook plays music along with the story.

title: The Likes of Which It Has Never Seen
summary: Guards burst into Level Six, only to find the prisoners have since escaped through the ceiling with the help of Jinbe and Crocodile. Shiryu offers his help, as the Newkamas try to catch up to Luffy, who ran ahead. Meanwhile, Buggy's group releases more prisoners, prompting Hannyabal's action.
cover: Straw Hats and Animals: Vivi prepares a meal with Terracotta. Meanwhile, Cobra and Matsuge spy on them.

title: Another Incident to Be Told
summary: Impel Down was in chaos, with Luffy and some prisoners on Level 4, Buggy and prisoners on Level 2, and the Blackbeard Pirates at the main entrance. Meanwhile, Ace was on his way to his execution.
